title: The Correspondence Theory: Truth Matches Reality
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Correspondence Theory: Truth Matches Reality.

hook.text: 'Snow is white' is true if â€” and only if â€” snow is actually white. Truth is a match between statement and reality.

buildup.text: The correspondence theory: a statement is true when it corresponds to facts in the world. Aristotle's original position.

discovery.text: It's intuitive: 'The cat is on the mat' is true when there's a cat, a mat, and the cat is on it.

twist.text: Problem: how do we access 'reality' to compare it with our statements? We only have perceptions â€” which can be wrong.

climax.text: Rival theories exist: coherentism, pragmatism. The debate continues.

punchline.text: Truth matches reality. The hard part is checking the match.

quiz.question: What does the correspondence theory of truth claim?
options: Truth is what most people agree on
A statement is true when it corresponds to facts in reality
Truth depends on who says it
